author: Doug Cameron
title: Smith & Wesson’s Parent Cuts Forecast, Sees Weak Market Ahead
text:
The largest U.S. gun manufacturer posted a 33% drop in quarterly sales and said flagging consumer demand was expected to last a further 12 to 18 months.
Smith & Wesson parent American Outdoor Brands Corp. warned of weaker sales and profit even as the glut of gun production that spurred a price war last year among manufacturers and retailers showed signs of easing. The company’s shares fell 10% in after-hours trading. The stock has declined by about half over the past year.
